event.title: Fomu, the FPGA in your USB Port
event.description:
Come get an FPGA dev board in your USB port and start hacking!
Get toolchain setup and you can get free hardware!

''(This is one of many cool things happening throughout CCCamp 2019 in the huge '''Hardware Hacking Area!)'''''

This workshop will be given multiple times (all identical):
   Day 1: 21-Aug, 10:00pm - 11:30pm
   Day 2: 22-Aug, 2:30pm - 4:30pm
   Day 3: 23-Aug, 5:30pm - 7:00pm
   Day 4: 24-Aug, 3:30pm - 5:00pm

event.title: Learn To Solder
event.subtitle: Day 1
event.description:
Learn to Solder! A large variety of way cool kits are available, all designed for total beginners to complete successfully -- and intriguing enough for the total hardware geek.

'''''This ongoing workshop will be happening concurrently with lots of other way cool workshops at the Hardware Hacking Area! All day & all night, throughout all of CCCamp2019.'''''

event.title: Surface Mount Electronics Assembly for Terrified Beginners - electronic kitten EXPERIMENTAL WORKSHOP
event.subtitle: EXPERIMENTAL Day 1 - 20:00
event.description: Experimental new workshop - Surface mount electronics for terrified beginners. Learn to assemble tiny parts on circuit boards by building an electronic touch-activated purring kitten. Anyone can do it. Yes, even you who never touched anything electronic before. 90-100mins, 20€/kit, avoid caffeine immediately before. Max 5 participants per session, there is a PAPER!!1! signup list in the hardware hacking area.

event.title: Free Software Song sing-along

event.title: Arduino For Total Newbies
event.subtitle: Day 2
event.description:
''Learn Arduino using TV-B-Gone as an example project''

You've probably heard lots about '''Arduino'''. But if you don't know what it is, or how you can use it to do all sorts of cool things, then this fun and easy workshop is for you. As an example project, we'll be creating a '''TV-B-Gone''' remote control out of an '''Arduino''' you can take home with you.

''(This is one of many cool things happening throughout CCCamp 2019 in the huge '''Hardware Hacking Area!)'''''

This workshop will be given twice
(both identical):
   Day 2: 22-Aug, 1pm - 4:30pm
   Day 3: 23-Aug, 1pm - 4:30pm

event.title: Regio Mediation
event.description: Streitigkeiten, die sich schon tiefer in einen Verein eingetreten haben oder sogar mit Machtgefällen behaftet sind, sind nicht einfach aus der Welt zu schaffen und können eine gute Vereinsarbeit über lange Zeit lähmen. Wir glauben, um diese Probleme zu lösen, könnenn uns die Techniken der Mediation weiterhelfen. Wir vermuten außerdem, dass schon viel Erfahrung im CCC und seinen Mitgliedern schlummert und wollen euch einladen mit uns Idee noch weiter auszuarbeiten.

Anarchist Networking Party w/ Las Vegas Lady and Planète Concrète
event.description: 20:30-22:30 Las Vegas Lady Sensual tunes and electronic beats: Welcome to this shiny abyss. http://soundcloud.com/lasvegaslady 22:30-00:00 Planète Concrète is an open universe staged by strange / loving creatures. Diy instruments, music performance and visual elements are the main instruments of this pink noise constellation http://ooooo.be/planeteconcrete/ https://soundcloud.com/planeteconcrete http://planeteconcrete.tumblr.com/

event.title: ArtesMobiles - SpeculativeAI
event.subtitle: 4pm - 6pm every 15 min
event.description: Performance // audiovisual experiment // @12m long white Bus with rooftop terasse

event.title: Mental Training Against Sexual Harassment
event.description: Once I told a friend about a situation where I was sexually harassed and froze, could not move, shrinked. She asked me to describe the situation and about my preferred reaction. Then we role played the situation. This scheme helped me a lot for real situations. This is what we want to do. More info below...

event.title: Networking Basics on the Command Line
event.description: @Heart of code-dome, by Theresa! What's an IP address and how do you get it? How does your computer manage to reach the whole world? How can you check what part of it went wrong? This hands-on workshop will give a basic overview of some networking concepts and tools, such as ip, ping, and traceroute. Then you will have time to try out the tools for yourself. Please bring a laptop.

event.title: Postapokalyptic jewellery
event.subtitle: scrap tinkering - schrottbasteln
event.description: living in the postapocalypse and noticing the beauty of relicts of human civilisation, we start to adorn and grace ourselves with it. the workshop offers to create more or less pretty jewellery things out of a big collection of found objects. bring your own nuggets or choose from provided material. there will be a donation box as sad enough the apocalypse didn't make capitalism history.

event.title: TechCoop Meetup
event.description: MeetUp for worker owned collectives and interested people

event.title: Trickmisch - Trickfilme erstellen
event.subtitle: Trickfilmworkshop
event.description: Animate your own drawings or use our huge collection of images made by newcomers. you are kindly invited to animate them analog on a lighting table or online on trixmix.tv You find us in the heart of code dome. (a very warm thank you at this point to Heart of Code for hosting us! :)

event.title: Arduino For Total Newbies
event.subtitle: Day 3
event.description:
''Learn Arduino using TV-B-Gone as an example project''

You've probably heard lots about '''Arduino'''. But if you don't know what it is, or how you can use it to do all sorts of cool things, then this fun and easy workshop is for you. As an example project, we'll be creating a '''TV-B-Gone''' remote control out of an '''Arduino''' you can take home with you.

''(This is one of many cool things happening throughout CCCamp 2019 in the huge '''Hardware Hacking Area!)'''''

This workshop will be given twice
(both identical):
   Day 2: 22-Aug, 1pm - 4:30pm
   Day 3: 23-Aug, 1pm - 4:30pm

Get toolchain setup and you can get free hardware!

   Day 2: 22-Aug, 2:30pm - 4:30pm

event.description: Try out a mechanical keyboard or show off your collection.

event.title: Surface Mount Electronics Assembly for Terrified Beginners
event.subtitle: Day 3 - 17:30
event.description: Surface mount electronics for terrified beginners. Learn to assemble tiny parts on circuit boards by building a working power supply. Anyone can do it. Yes, even you who never touched anything electronic before. 90-100mins, 20€/kit, avoid caffeine immediately before. Max 17 participants per session, there is a PAPER!!1! signup list in the hardware hacking area.

event.subtitle: Follow up

event.subtitle: about:sessions

event.description: Planning an action and discussing communication tech during our rebellion week in october

event.title: FIfF-Stammtische everywhere - gründet Ortsgruppen
event.subtitle: about:stage
event.description: found local discussion groups

event.title: Freedom to go - an interactive workshop from An- to F- to G-Droid
event.subtitle: about:sessions
event.description: An interactive workshop to present the Free Software App repository called F-Droid and the outstanding functionalities of its clients called F-Droid and G-Droid. After that we discover the best (imho!) Android-based Free Software apps including methods of anonymization and encryption - and you will have the possibility to present your personal favorite Free Software app as well.

event.title: Global Climate Strike: exchange of ideas and experiences about organizing strikes and demonstrations
event.subtitle: about:stage
event.description: The climate crisis is an emergency but we’re not acting like it. Especially in political organizations like the Chaos Community this topic has to be more present, more visible. Our hotter planet is already hurting millions of people. We are not only in one of the best positions to provide technology for change, but we also should show that we belong to the people behind the movements like Fridays For Future or Global Climate Strike.

event.title: Hackers Against Climate Change
event.subtitle: about:dome
event.description: Meetup/Discussion for Hackers concerned with Climate Change

event.title: Join CCC Sustainability (c3sus) and help make CCC events sustainable
event.subtitle: about:dome
event.description: CCC Sustainability is a young orga team that tries to make CCC events more sustainable by proposing solutions to existing teams and help to implement them

event.title: Ola Bini: unfairly persecuted
event.subtitle: about:stage
event.description: Ola Bini has been unfairly persecuted for almost 130 days in Ecuador. Let's discuss about that!

event.title: R5 Meeting (CCC working group)
event.subtitle: about:stage
event.description: Reuse, Repair, Recycle, Rethink, Redesign (R5) is a working group of the CCC. This session is for people that are already part of it, and people that would like to get involved.

event.title: Substrate verifiable credentials - build your first infrastructure blockchain
event.description: In this workshop you'll learn to build your own infrastructure blockchain (for verifiable credentials) using Substrate, Rust and WebAssembly.

event.title: Testing economic incentives on the Kusama Blockchain
event.subtitle: about:sessions
event.description: soon Kusama, the Polkadot Chaos Canary network, is going to launch. In this session we'll dive into how this blockchain network will be used to test ecnomic incentives

event.title: Wifi4EU - broken by technical specifications
event.subtitle: about:stage
event.description: With the Wifi4EU programm the EU is planning to spend 100 million € by 2020 to subsidise a centralized surveillance infrastructure for centers of public life in the EU. The talk will lay out how Wifi4EU is supposed to work both administratively and technically, where there are problems with the later and what is and can be done about it.

event.title: Blinking Selfmade LED Ear Ring Workshop
event.subtitle: Hands-On Workshop Day3- evening
event.description: Soldering Blinking Ear Rings

event.title: Bodymind Operating System
event.description: '''Physical practice session ''' where we explore the notions of hacking through the human body.

event.title: SUSI.AI Open Source Voice Assistant
event.subtitle: Learn about SUSI.AI and how to build your own smart speaker
event.description: We are developing a smart speaker that can play music through voice commands. Users can play music from online resources such as radio stations, YouTube, their cloud folder (e.g. Nextcloud) as well as from locally connected USB sticks or music available in the local network.

event.description: We want to meet and discuss the requirements and possibilities of setting up a microgrid solution for future camping events.

event.title: Cheese Rendezvous
event.subtitle: Session II.
event.description: Selection of delicious cheeses and condiments for you!

event.title: Club culture against the monopoly of Facebook
event.description: Reclaim Club Culture goes Fediverse, we want to learn about alternatives to facebook: We need a platform that includes social multimedia feeds and most importantly: a calendar for mobilization/invitation. We will prepare a campaign to get institutions of the cultural scene to use that alternative platform.

event.title: Hybrid DTN & Mobil Adhoc Routing Protocol
event.subtitle: agnostic routing protocol which covers mobile ad hoc routing
event.description: We currently develop a network agnostic routing protocol which covers mobile ad hoc routing as well as delay tolerant package store and forward routing. This routing protocol is part of the project qaul.net, an Internet independent wireless mesh communication app. In this session we would like to discuss and develop our ideas and concepts further. Everybody is invited to contribute ideas and/or just learn more about the subject.

event.title: Advanced web tracking methods
event.subtitle: about:stage
event.description: Advanced browser tracking techniques have developed over the last decade that allow remote sites to leverage the increasingly feature-rich web to track users without their knowledge or consent. Not only are distinct visits across sites logged via techniques such as browser fingerprinting, sites that handle our most intimate details are monitoring our behavior on pages and handing that information to third parties with little to no regard to our privacy. This will cover some of those advanced techniques that have emerged, and how to protect yourself against pervasive web tracking.

event.title: Bandwidth Matters, Information controls in a conflict state in India
event.description: What does information controls look like in conflict states of India? How does indias surveillance apparatus further intensify the information controls in conflict areas? How does this affect the everyday life of people esp women living and promoting peace in these regions?

event.title: Digital Services Act: The future of Internet in the next rules on Intermediary Liability
event.subtitle: Panel on Intermediary Liability @ about:stage
event.description: '''CDT - Center for Democracy & Technology''', will discuss with valuable guests the political and legislative initiatives already in place and the safeguards that the new Digital Services Act must take into consideration in order to do not harm freedom of expression, access to information, and innovation and entrepreneurship on the internet.

event.title: Discussion on privacy-friendly green policies in the European Union
event.subtitle: about:sessions
event.description: How can we combine environmental issues with privacy-friendly solutions? Knowing that privacy comes at a cost of efficiency, what should the red lines be in the privacy VS environment debate? Is the fight for privacy in green policy the beginning of the end for surveillance capitalism?

event.title: Illegal content online – Bringing rights-based solutions to the EU table
event.subtitle: about:stage
event.description: EDRi proposes a political workshop to stress-test human rights-based solutions to ongoing debates in EU Brussels bubble: platforms' responsibilities towards illegal content online, prosecution of online crimes and conditions for law enforcement to access online evidence.

event.title: Learn To Solder
event.subtitle: Day 5
event.description:
Learn to Solder! A large variety of way cool kits are available, all designed for total beginners to complete successfully -- and intriguing enough for the total hardware geek.

'''''This ongoing workshop will be happening concurrently with lots of other way cool workshops at the Hardware Hacking Area! All day & all night, throughout all of CCCamp2019.'''''

event.title: Postapokalyptic jewellery
event.subtitle: scrap tinkering - schrottbasteln
event.description: living in the postapocalypse and noticing the beauty of relicts of human civilisation, we start to adorn and grace ourselves with it. the workshop offers to create more or less pretty jewellery things out of a big collection of found objects. bring your own nuggets or choose from provided material. there will be a donation box as sad enough the apocalypse didn't make capitalism history.
